property Tags : TVorbisTags read FTags write SetTags
Use this property to add a set of Vorbis-style comments (artist, title, etc.)
General information about the disc in the drive.
The status of the CD-ROM drive.
procedure TearDown; override
Analagous to Destroy, all cleanup should occur in this procedure.
You can call the output component’s Stop method to terminate an ongoing playback at any time, but because of the multithreaded nature of NewAC the playback doesn’t stop at once when requested.
Intended to be a prototype class.
Some of NewAC components require certain shared libraries, which are not included in the package but are publicly available and may be found on many sites.
property ThreadPriority : {$IFDEF LINUX} Integer {$ENDIF} {$IFDEF WIN32} TThreadPriority {$ENDIF} read GetPriority write SetPriority
This property allows you to set the priority of the output thread.
property TimeElapsed : Integer read GetTE
The time in seconds that has passed since the playback was started.

property TotalBlocks: Integer read GetTotalBlocks
The total number of blocks in the file.
property TotalSamples : Int64 read GetTotalSamples
A read only property which returns number of samples (frames) in the input stream.
property TotalTime : LongWord read GetTotalTime
A read only property which returns input playback time in seconds.
property Tracks[const vIndex : Integer] : TCDTrackInfo read GetTrackInfo
Returns information about a track specified by its number.
property TracksCount : Integer read GetNumTracks
The number of tracks on the disc.

A unit to facilitate encoding and decoding files using NewAC.
property Underruns : Integer read FUnderruns
This read only property returns the number of internal buffer underruns that have occured during recording.
property Underruns : LongWord read FUnderruns
This read only property returns the number of internal buffer underruns that have occured during playback.
Almost all NewAC components that read data from audio files or store data in audio file format can work with both disk files and memory streams (currently only TMACIn and TMACOut components do not support general streams).
The primary testing unit, used in the DUnit test project.
These functions are provided to try and make this unit as accessible as possible.
All common functions (and some not so common) go in here.
property Valid : Boolean read GetValid
Read this property to determine if the file is valid.
property Verify : Boolean read FVerify write FVerify
Setting Verify to True forces the FLAC encoder to verify its own output.
property Volume1 : Byte read FVolume1 write FVolume1
Use Volume1 to set the volume of the first stream in the resulting mixed stream.

Read this property to get tags (artist, title, etc.)

procedure WriteToFile(sLine: string;  
sFileName: string = '')
The heart of the unit, writes a single line to the file specified in sFilename, or FFilename if sFilename is blank.
Your main goal as an input component writer is to decode audio data from the format you are working with into the NewAC format and to provide additional parameters for representing an audio stream.
When writing an output component you always have to override three methods: Prepare, DoOutput and Done.
Eventually you may want to extend NewAC with your own components.

a WAV which is DVIADPCM (uhh..)
a WAV which is PCM (the normal format, use this if you’re unsure)
a WAV format that isn’t supported
